instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message: Hi, I have a A1707 820-00281 with the infamous question mark folder. I saw a video of the 1706 witch has a failing probe point in many cases. Any know issues for this A1707 15 inch touchbar with regards to SSD drives failing?

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message:
Is Lifeboat bypass connected?
Also check if you get all SSD voltages.

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message: Yes connected. No short on all SSD powerlines. I get 3.3v and 1.8v but both then drop to 0v One capacitor looks like its a bit corroded, measures still OK though no short on that one. Its C9390 pin 1 thats a bit corroded.

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message:
If SSD voltages drop, is the reason of question mark folder.
All SSD voltages must come and stay on.

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message: So i reassembled the machine, running on battery power. I have all voltages 12v, 1.8v and 3.3v should there be something else?

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message: I have SSD_RESET_L = 3.2v. SSD_PWR_EN =3.25v, SSD Nand has 1.2 and 1.8v

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message:
Found a short, now I have following issue. The board is an 820-00928-A and I have the boardview and schematics for 820-00928, doesnt say A. Mostly looks identical but the area where I found the short is slightly different, see attached image from my boardview as well as the board in question. Is there different versions of this board?

PS sorry i wrote the model wrong in the tittle

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message:
Be sure to have schematic and boardview for Baffin2,
Baffin (X363G) is 00281.

Where did you find the short?

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message: Attached pics. I have the 00281 will check

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message: Post a power rail name for that short...

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message: I can't find as my schematics don't match even the 281 is different.... See attached

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message:
Is your schematic/boardview for Baffin2???
Baffin is not good; is for 00281.

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message:
yes it is, so they sold me the wrong one :mad:

This is what I have =>  SCHEM,MLB_BAFFIN2

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message:
Check against Baffin then, see if better.
Why did you spend money for schematic, instead of asking here???

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message: I always buy them, fast :) The IC that are shorted are not in Baffin2 so we have no clue what line is shorted. I have emailed my schematics supplier maybe by now he has the correct one. WIll let you know if I got it. If you need schematics here are a lot listed for free -> [url]https://download.itadmins.net/Schematics/Apple/Macbook/[/url]

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message: Just to make it clear, I have schematics for Baffin and Baffin2. The corresponsing boardviews that came with these are identical, just named different 281 and 928. Maybe its just the wrong boardview that was included and the scematics is OK.

threads.title: A1707 820-00281 question mark folder
threads.message: That shorted power rail should go to some connector, or another easy component to locate on boardview...
